page.title: 08MOTORWAY
page.content: 500 metres outside Wadworth there is a motorway junction for the A1M and M18 motorways. There is a very large roundabout with bridges. If you go down White Cross Lane, you go under some of the bridges.On the M18 one way goes to Hull one to Sheffield. The A1 motorway goes from Edinburgh to London. The motorway altogether looks like a spaghetti junction. A motorway is a very big road on which cars travel at 70 miles an hour. The A1M has two lanes and is the oldest of the roads and is called the Doncaster By-Pass because the main A1 once went through Doncaster. This always caused traffic jams. The M18 has three lanes and was only made ten years ago. There are no service areas on the M18. With the Doncaster By Pass there are services at both ends.
